_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Oshkosh Cold Storage. - Executive Summary



Risk Management Program

Anhydrous Ammonia Refrigeration System

February 2021

Executive Summary



1.    Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source.

Oshkosh Cold Storage. Company has prepared a Risk Management Program (RMP) in accordance with Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations, Part 68. Oshkosh Cold Storage is committed to providing a safe work environment for our employees and to prevent or minimize any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. Oshkosh Cold Storage prepared the RMP to satisfy regulatory requirements and to demonstrate our commitment to the safe handling of anhydrous ammonia at our facility. 



2.    The stationary source and substances handled.

Oshkosh Cold Storage. Company is located at 4385 County Road PP, Plymouth, WI. This is a refrigerated storage to store processed dairy products manufactured at customers' facilities. Anhydrous ammonia, a common industrial refrigerant, is maintained in a closed refrigeration system for the purpose of temperature control for dairy products.



3.    The general accidental release prevention program and prevention steps.

The refrigeration system incorporates redundant safety controls to prevent and mitigate potential releases. The system is continuously monitored by computer control systems that will shut down components that exceed normal operating limits.  Other safety features of the system include:

    -Pressure relief valves installed on all pressure vessels

    -Relief activation alarm systems

    -Manual emergency shutdown systems

    -Automated emergency ventilation system

    -Ammonia detection systems.

    

Administrative controls to maintain safe system operation in compliance with OSHA Process Safety Management and EPA Risk Management Program regulations, include:

-Employee Participation Program

-Process Safety Information

-Process Hazard Analysis

-Operating Procedures

-Training Program

-Contractor Safety Progra

m

-Pre-Startup Safety Review Procedures

-Mechanical Integrity Program

-Hot Work Permit Program

-Management of Change Procedures

-Incident Investigation Procedures

-Emergency Planning and Response Procedures

-Compliance Audit Procedures



4.    Five year accident history

Oshkosh Cold Storage has had no reportable releases since the last RMP Update (02/28/2016)

5.    The Emergency Action Plan

In the unlikely event of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia, Oshkosh Cold Storage personnel are trained in appropriate response measures.  Contract personnel are on call 24/7 to respond to releases in accordance with OSHA HAZWOPER regulations. The emergency action plan includes procedures for notification of local emergency responders.



6.    Planned changes to improve safety.

Most of the changes recommended by the Process Hazard Analysis Team have been implemented.
